Name: Public hearing on public burial and related issues.
Title: A Local Law in relation to a public hearing on public burial and related issues
Summary: This bill would require a public hearing on public burial to allow the public the opportunity to discuss the laws, rules, regulations, policies and procedures related to public burial, to recommend changes to these programs and to consider the feasibility of alternative programs. Following the hearing, the Department of Social Services would submit a report with recommendations to the Mayor and the Council.

\pard\ltrpar\noline\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\cf0\highlight0\lang1033\ulnone Section 1. \cf1\lang9 Public burial hearing. a. There shall be a public hearing, information about which shall be posted on the department\rquote s website at least 30 days in advance, to provide the public an opportunity to comment on and make recommendations regarding changes to the laws, rules, regulations, policies and procedures related to public burial.\highlight3\par
\highlight0 b. The commissioner of social services, or their designee, shall convene and preside over the public hearing. The chief executive officer of the New York city health and hospitals corporation or such designee shall be invited to attend the public hearing with the representatives of city agencies identified herein. The following agency officers, or their designees, shall also attend the public hearing:\par
1. The commissioner of health and mental hygiene;\par
2. The commissioner of correction;\par
3. The chief medical examiner;\par
4. The commissioner of parks and recreation;\tab\par
c. The department of social services shall invite, at least 30 days in advance of the hearing, through a written invitation, at least the following members of the public to provide public testimony:\par
 1. At least two advocates who specialize in issues related to public burial or Hart island;\par
 2. At least one member of the public who has opted for public burial of a deceased person; and\par
 3. At least one member of the public who specializes in medical ethics or issues relating to medical privacy.  \par
d. The commissioner of social services shall request that testimony include, but need not be limited to, the following:\par
1. The process for identifying, finding and contacting next of kin or legally responsible relative when a deceased individual is identified for public burial;\par
2. \cf0\lang1033 Support for and communication with \cf1\lang9 next of kin or legally responsible relative\cf0\lang1033  who choose to direct the disposition of the decedent\rquote s remains to public burial or seek assistance from the department of social services\rquote  burial programs, including \cf1\lang9 what information is provided regarding public burial, burial assistance program and Hart island;\par
3. Procedures for burial of indigent, unclaimed individuals and individuals wherein the next of kin or legally responsible relative directs disposition of the remains to public burial;\par
4. The department of social services\rquote  burial assistance program;\par
5. The feasibility of implementation of a cremation assistance program or providing cremation as an alternative to public burial; \par
6. The feasibility or potential feasibility of public burial in locations other than Hart island, both inside and outside of the city; \par
7. The plan for the future operation of Hart island;\par
8. Recommendations for promoting efficiency and accessibility to the public of existing and proposed programs in connection with public burial; and\par
9. Recommendations for changes to the system allowing the public to find burial information on Hart island, that takes into consideration the public interest in searching such information and in protecting personally identifying information and medical privacy.\par
e. The department of social services shall submit to the mayor and speaker of the council and \cf0\lang1033 post on its website\cf1\lang9  a report summarizing and, where appropriate, responding to such testimony no later than January 15, 2020.  \par
\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately \cf0\lang1033 and is deemed repealed on January 15, 2020 or the day after submission of the report required by section one of this local law, whichever is later.  \cf1\highlight2\lang9\fs27\par
